attrs.description: The unique identifier for this board. The board name can contain alphanumeric characters (Aa-Zz, 0-9), hyphens (-) and underscores (_) only.

attrs.description: A comma-delimited list of strings to test for exclusion against the HTTP request's user-agent string. If a given include string matches the user-agent string, the content inside the include tag does not appear; otherwise it does appear.

children.description: Displays the contents wrapped inside the tag to the specified user-agents. You can use fb:user-agent on the canvas page and the profile box. It serves as a tool to deal with browser idiosyncrasies.

attrs.description: The URL from which to fetch the FBML. Facebook caches the content retrieved from that URL until you call fbml.refreshRefUrl. You must specify either url or handle, but not bot

children.description: Fetches and renders FBML from a given ref source – either a ref string "handle" you've created using fbml.setRefHandle or a URL that serves FBML. You can use this ref to publish identical FBML to a large number of user profiles and subsequently update those profiles, without having to republish FBML on behalf of each user (that is, using profile.setFBML for each user).
children.label: fb:ref

attrs.description: The ID of the form to be submitted.
attrs.name: form_id
attrs.label: form_id

children.description: Creates a JavaScript submission mechanism for a form, which makes image or text links act as Submit buttons. Markup contained by this tag is surrounded with an <a> tag that includes a submit onclick acti
children.label: fb:submit

children.description: Renders a link in a wall or message attachment that, when clicked, replaces that attachment with newly fetched content. The URL from which the content is fetched is a hidden input in the current content, and all other inputs in the content are posted.
children.label: fb:attachment-preview

children.description: Renders the heading text for an error, explanation or success message.
children.label: fb:message

attrs.description: The heading text to display in the success box. Alternately, you can specify the heading text using an child.
attrs.name: message
attrs.label: message

attrs.description: Customize the appearance of the success message box by choosing among two styles:
attrs.name: decoration
attrs.label: decoration

children.description: Renders a standard Facebook success message. The content within the <fb:success> tags is used as the success explanation
children.label: fb:success

attrs.description: The heading text to display in the explanation box. Alternately, you can specify the heading text using an child.
attrs.name: message
attrs.label: message

attrs.description: Customize the appearance of the explanation by choosing from two styles:
attrs.name: decoration
attrs.label: decoration

children.description: Renders a standard Facebook explanation message. The content contained within the <fb:explanation> tags is used as the explanation text
children.label: fb:explanation

children.description: Creates two drop down list boxes that let a user select a date. The month is listed using a three-letter abbreviation, and the day is listed as a numerical digit from 1 to 31 (with no leading zeroes).

attrs.label: label

attrs.label: name

attrs.name: width

attrs.label: labelwidth

children.description: Creates a form with two columns, just like the form on the edit-profile page. The children of fb:editor specify the rows of the form. For example, an child adds a row with a text field in the right column. The label attribute of the fb:editor-* child specifies what text appears in the left column of that row.
children.label: fb:editor

children.label: fb:editor-divider

attrs.name: icon

attrs.description: Customize the appearance of the title by choosing among three styles:  add_border - Adds a 1px solid #ccc border to the bottom of the header. Useful for pages with gray backgrounds below the header.  no_padding - Removes the 20px of padding that is on the header by default. shorten - Removes the 20px of padding from the bottom of the hea
attrs.name: decoration
attrs.label: decoration

children.description: Renders a standard Facebook title header.
children.label: fb:header

children.description: Renders a standard media header, intended mainly for displaying content contributed by a particular user. The media header is shown at the top of See All pages throughout Facebook. It contains a photo of the media owner and links to actions on that user.
children.label: fb:mediaheader

children.description: Specifies the header title for a .
children.label: fb:header-title

children.description: Renders a group of standard Facebook navigation tabs. Must contain at least one .
children.label: fb:tabs

children.description: Renders a standard Facebook dashboard header.

attrs.description: The user ID of the author of the post. FBML cannot parse without it, resulting in a runtime error. If the user ID is invalid (for example, the account has been deleted) then an image of a question mark and no name appear.
attrs.name: uid
attrs.label: uid

attrs.description: The current time, which is displayed in epoch seconds. Default value is empty, no time/date is displayed with the wall post
attrs.name: t
attrs.label: t

children.description: Renders a wall-style post. You should use it inside tags, but it renders fine without them. It can also contain an tag, which places a link at the bottom of the post.
children.label: fb:wallpost

children.description: fb:dialog-content is a child of  and is what is displayed inside the popup dialog when it appears.
children.label: fb:dialog-content

children.description: Emulates a wall environment.

children.description: Important: The fb:dialog tag is in beta mode right now, which means there is a possibility it can change. When it is fully stable, Facebook will update the announcements page and remove this note. In the meantime, we would appreciate any feedback/issues you have about fb:dialog.
children.label: fb:dialog

children.description: Displays a link at the bottom of a wallpost (even if it appears before other text within the tag).
children.label: fb:wallpost-action
